I help to bring education and joy into other people's lives.

1804-1881, Former British Prime Minister

lenders.name: Don & Peg
lenders.loan_because:
Throughout their lives Don and Peg loaned money to struggling micro-entrepreneurs often enough to stretch their own household budget past the comfort zone.  They did this in the Salinas Valley from the 1960s to the 1980s long before micro-finance emerged as an accepted way to promote development and fight poverty. 

This account is funded by Don and Peg's money and contributions from their family and friends as a living and life-enhancing memorial.  

Don and Peg's fund loans to only a few places.  Mexico where they spent the happiest 15 years of their lives.  The island of Hispanola, especially Haiti which made a profound impression on them during the summer of 1982.  Samoa in the South Pacific because of Don's experiences there in WWII.  And finally, Nicaragua because Don and Peg's grandsons are establishing ties of service and business in that country.
lenders.occupational_info:
Along the way Don worked as a carpenter, a machinist mate, a metals fabricator, and a teacher. He found an avid vocation cooking for his family and for the homeless of Salinas, CA during the 1970s and 1980s.  

Peg was an industrial seamstress, assembly line worker, mother, homemaker, writer, teacher, community activist and through it all an voracious reader.  

Don and Peg were married for 58 years.  All families have leavers and stayers.  Don and Peg were always leavers.  They left the coalfields of southern Illinois for St. Louis after WW2.  In the early 1950s John Steinbeck's "Mother Road" beckoned and they followed old Route 66 all the way to the Santa Monica pier.  Leaving LA five years later to settle in Salinas, CA where they would raise their children before leaving again.  In retirement they followed the coast south to Ensenada, Mexico and settled into a small adobe house to live out the remaining good years of their lives among many new friends.  

Don left for good in June 2005 with Peg following soon after in November 2007.

Also all of us who can read this on a computer had a hand up from a teacher, a mentor or parents or friends or relatives; so why not give a hand up to another person and pass on your blessings, not to mention it feels wonderful to be able to give a hand up to someone!

lenders.name: MainStreet
lenders.loan_because: In the USA, MainStreet Lender works to advance small businesses every day. We provide government guaranteed and conventional loans to small business owners nationwide. But through Kiva, we also strive to provide opportunity to small business owners throughout the world. We believe small business and entrepreneurs is the best way to provide independence and opportunity, and create prosperity.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a commercial non-bank lender, and we provide loans for the purchase or refinance of businesses and real estate to a variety of small enterprises in industries such as hospitality, medical, automotive, retail, and manufacturing.

lenders.name: Lova
lenders.loan_because: Being a broke 24 years old economics student, I'm starting a new internet business called blogadollar.com . It will be a FREE ressource for anyone wanting to start his/her own home-based business and website. The problem with websites is they're hard to promote and get new visitors and traffic to. That is the lifeblood of a website and many many people fail and continue to fail at driving traffic to their website. Blogadollar.com is my 24 old student brain's product, it's a new web 2.0 generation blog, I try to bring a huge value to the self little guys entrepreneurs via blogadollar.com, by working hard to give them what they so desperatly want, "Step by Step info about driving swarm of traffic to their blog/website" and finally make it successful and popular. To do that, I intend to and already work very hard on researching a lot of info about how to drive targeted traffic to one's website, sort the info, pull out only what is proven to work and praised by REAL-Life users. I already have a ton of info just waiting to be laid out on blogadollar. I loan because this venture started on may 5th 2007, 3 months ago but really starts to take off only 3 weeks now, because before, I was still having my 2nd semester exams. [I succeded an dgraduated from master 1 to master 2] It's also taking a lot of my time and requires hard work (I mean all day long). It's ok while it's the summer hollyday period. But I'm afraid not to be able to achieve my goals on time without more capital. The goal is to build the blog as much as possible and promote it as much as possible before september. (back to college time). When I'm back to college, I will still push blogadollar very hard and even harder and work very very hard of course, but it is obvious that it's best to do it now while I have all the time while it's summer's hollydays. Instead of having fun outside, like a lot of lucky 24 Year old youngs around, I'm on my desk working hard each and every day now, between my notebooks where I plan everything, and the computer connected to the Internet, where I apply everything I've planned from the notebooks. The notebooks are on topics like on-page optimisation, off-page optimisation, social networking, social bookmarking, blog promotion, internet marketing, taking action, daily tasks, progression status, web 2.0 etc etc... All of this is aimed to make blogadollar as successful and thriving as his counterparts who are earning $10,000 per month, while helping others acheve the same goal. This is a real win-win new venture. Now you know that I'm a 24 years old student, my background is that I'm skilled the most in computers and now in internet in this difficult to live world, and that's why I'm focusing highly on this venture. This is what I can do the best. I'm not best at anything else. So, I'll never let go, and need your help. Without your help, I'll continue and will succed anyway. With your help, I'll continue and succeed way way faster and help way way more people thriving with their home-biz too. This new venture has the huge potential to earn $10,000+ per month in a period as short as 6 to 8 months due to the ad revenue potential like it's other pairs on the market do enjoy already. And the market is wide open for anyone.
lenders.occupational_info: - My aim is to work hard to make blogadollar.com the place that any little home-biz entrepreneur guy thinks of when he struggles getting his/her new web 2.0 generation blog/website to where he wants it to be. He/She wants a lot of traffic, a lot of visitors, a lot of page views, a lot of step by step, REAL step by step info about generating REAL web traffic and building momentum around their own website. - The goal is to show the little guy How to explode his traffic using precise, proven and tested through REAL-Life case studies techniques and methods and finally breathe new-life into their blog/website. - My job will be to boost their site from “ordinary” to extraordinary… - To Show them How to quickly set up their Social Networking presence and avoid the mistakes most people make when they want to leverage their pages for business promotion -How to set their blog apart so it doesn’t look like a “me too” and uses direct marketing principles that “hook” their audience faster than a speeding Ferrari! -The steps for “working” your blog like a pro… avoiding the classic mistakes rookies commit that keep their blogs working AGAINST them! And much much more. I need your help to achieve that faster. You can take a look at blogadollar by clicking this link: blogadollar.com

lenders.name: Yan
lenders.loan_because: I know what the struggles are like to set up your own business - I own a theatre company. Whereas these people have the opportunity to achieve loans through the goodwill of people, avoiding all the financial assessment redtape. I hope that by giving my little every time, I am able to raise somebody's hopes, and who knows? My dollar could be the turning point of someone's life.

lenders.name: Ricky Buchanan

lenders.occupational_info: I do volunteer work via the phone and the internet, mostly to help other people with disabilities. I also write and do various creative stuff. I run the website http://atmac.org/ about assistive tech for Mac OS X users with disabilities, and http://bedbound.org/ for bedridden and housebound people.

Olivia is an eight and a half year old third grade student
Debra is a mom to five kids:  an 18 year-old college-bound daughter; a   21 year-old step-daughter attending univerity in Illinois; a 24 year-old step son living in Las Vegas; a ten-year-old daughter in fifth grade; and Olivia, who thought it would be fun and exciting to join Mom in this venture!

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: We get great satisfaction knowing we're helping someone, so helping people through KIVA is really a gift to ourselves.

lenders.name: Regan
lenders.loan_because: I try to live my life by the words of Gandhi, "Be the change you wish to see in the world." I know that I can make a difference in these people's lives, so why would I ignore that opportunity to do some good in the world?
lenders.occupational_info: I attend University in the UK even though I was born in America. I have a degree in Philosophy and am currently studying for my Masters in South Asian religions. I hope to become a lawyer who works with charities and nonprofit organizations.
